CatDescriptText: Chester White, Coraopolis and Harold Ford, city worker, Fifth Ward were were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 22, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you think Negro voters consider local or national issues in the casting of their votes?" Mr. White's answer reads: "In a national election, I think voters, in general, cast their votes on how the party stands on national issues...They vote for the group which will improve the social condition of everyone."  Mr. Ford's answer reads: "They vote mostly on local issues, because they receive the most benefits at this level."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Chester White wearing dark textured suit jacket and striped necktie, standing on Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Harold Ford wearing overalls, moustache, and cap, standing in front of stores and sign
